messages.message: Hi team, do `batch.ibflowresults` still have a DB dependency? For context, we want to have the same demos available in multiple environments, and want a single S3 connected to all of them. Do we also need to share the DBs to allow us to open the results files still? Similar to what we had with prod and dogfood when they shared a DB and storage?
@Lee, yes that would be true, we would need to share DBs for flow v2.
Thanks. Is that changing with V3?

Yes, currently viewing flow v3 result can work without sharing database as wellâ€¦
CC: @Rakesh
This is initial state for flow v3 results (does not pull flow result /status from DB). We would revisit this holistically in Q4 on how flow results will be updated and reported.
Thanks both, thats good to know, not having a DB linking dependency is definitely preferred. Lots of confusion with customers around this.
@Lee - will make a note of this as we work on this in Q4.
